block.p: MONDAY The Commerce Department reports on personal income and spending for December. Income is expected to have risen three-tenths of a percentage point, and spending five-tenths. The Commerce Department details construction spending for December. Analysts expect a rise of eight-tenths of a point from November. The National Association of Purchasing Management issues its index for January.

MONDAY The Commerce Department reports on personal income and spending for December. Income is expected to have risen three-tenths of a percentage point, and spending five-tenths. The Commerce Department details construction spending for December. Analysts expect a rise of eight-tenths of a point from November. The National Association of Purchasing Management issues its index for January.

TUESDAY The Federal Open Market Committee meets to set monetary policy, and is expected to leave interest rates unchanged. The Conference Board issues the leading economic indicators for December. Little change is forecast. The Commerce Department releases new-home sales for December. A slight drop is expected.
THURSDAY The Commerce Department reports on factory orders for December. A drop of 2 percent is expected.
FRIDAY The Labor Department announces the unemployment rate for December. Another small drop, to 4.6 percent, looks possible.
